DOC.brief_summary: Quick start combined oral contraception contain estradiol hemihydrate/nomegestrol acetate effective inhibit ovulation healthy reproductive age woman non-inferiority combined oral contraception contain ethinyl estradiol/gestodene .
DOC.brief_title: Ovulation Follicular Development Associated With Mid Follicular Phase Initiation Combined Hormonal Contraception
DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize control , non-inferiority trial compare proportion ovulation two oral combine pill delay start first tablet mid-follicular phase menstrual cycle 18 - 40 year old , healthy woman prior normal regular period . Participations undergone trans-vaginal trans-rectal ultrasonography day 1 - 3 menstrual period evaluation ovarian follicle/cyst ( present ) . Only woman normal look ovary without dominant ovarian follicle include study-protocol . Immediately trans-vaginal/trans-rectal ultrasound day 7 - 9 menstrual period , participant randomly assign receive one pack investigate pill ( 1.5 mg estradiol hemihydrate/2.5 mg nomegestrol acetate 20 mcg ethinyl estradiol/75 mcg gestodene ) take first tablet direct observation research-nurse . Participants take one consecutive tablet time day complete pack . The next appointment every 2 - 3 day monitor ovarian function use Hoogland score ovulation follicular quiescence present . The last visit 1 week complete pack monitor adverse effect safety protocol .
DOC.criteria: healthy woman , age 18 40 year prior normal regular interval menstruation current breast feeding woman within 1 month period childdelivery miscarriage body mass index 30 kg/m2 contraindicate use combine hormonal contraception current use hormonal drug affect ovulation function
